parts.text:
```xml
<output>
<analysis>
<has-cmf>The post does not contain a CMF number. While the absence of a CMF number is not automatically disqualifying, it suggests the post might not be directly linked to official electoral campaign materials.</has-cmf>
<refers-to-candidate>The post uses hashtags such as "#echipapentruilfovsenat", "#GyőzzönAJózanÉsz", "#AlegeVoceaRațiunii", and "#UDMR".  These hashtags clearly refer to the UDMR party and implicitly promote Demeter András István, who is running for the Senate in Ilfov County. The hashtags directly link the candidate to the party and suggest a call to action (vote for the candidate/party). This fulfills "Article 36 (7) - a".</refers-to-candidate>
<addresses-the-wide-population>The post is a paid Facebook advertisement, targeting a wide audience based on the provided insights data. The reach estimate is ">1M", indicating a broad dissemination intended to reach a large number of people. This fulfills "Article 36 (7) - c".</addresses-the-wide-population>
<electoral-objective>The hashtags and the overall message strongly suggest an electoral objective. The hashtags are explicitly promoting the UDMR party and the candidate, aiming to influence voters to support them. The use of paid advertising further reinforces this intention. This fulfills "Article 36 (7) - c".</electoral-objective>
<journalism>The content does not present itself as journalistic. It lacks objective reporting, analysis, or diverse perspectives. Instead, it focuses on promoting a specific candidate and party, lacking the neutrality expected from journalistic content.</journalism>
<personal_opinion>The post does not express a personal opinion; it's a clear promotional message for a political candidate and party.</personal_opinion>
</analysis>

<conclusion>
<post_id>1090600686123484</post_id>
<electoral-propaganda-analysis>
The Facebook post, given its paid nature, targeting a wide audience, and the use of explicit hashtags promoting a specific candidate (Demeter András István) and party (UDMR) for the Senate elections, strongly suggests it constitutes electoral propaganda.  The hashtags directly call for support, and the targeting data shows a broad reach. While the absence of a CMF number might be considered a mitigating factor, the overall intent and effect of the post are clearly to influence the election outcome. The post's content and context strongly suggest it violates Article 36 (7) of LEGE nr. 334 din 17 iulie 2006, and therefore likely violates Article 98 t) of LEGE nr. 208 din 20 iulie 2015, if the electoral propaganda period has ended.
</electoral-propaganda-analysis>
<electoral-propaganda-decision>TRUE</electoral-propaganda-decision>
<electoral-propaganda-candidates>
  <candidate><name>Demeter András István</name><impact>POSITIVE</impact></candidate>
</electoral-propaganda-candidates>
<responsible-party-or-group>UDMR</responsible-party-or-group>
<message-for-police>
RMDSZ/UDMR, pentru încălcarea articolului 98 t) din LEGEA nr. 208 din 20 iulie 2015, prin publicarea unei reclame plătite pe Facebook după ora 18:00 pe 23.11.2024, cu ID-ul 1090600686123484, care promovează candidatul Demeter András István la Senat pentru UDMR, folosind hashtag-uri precum "#echipapentruilfovsenat", "#GyőzzönAJózanÉsz", "#AlegeVoceaRațiunii", și "#UDMR", având un efect electoral clar de influențare a votului în favoarea acestuia. Reclama, cu o estimare a acoperirii de peste 1 milion de persoane, depășește limitele activității jurnalistice și are ca obiectiv influențarea votului, conform articolului 36 (7) din LEGEA nr. 334 din 17 iulie 2006.  Cheltuielile pentru reclamă sunt sub 100 RON, conform datelor din Ad Library, iar datele de contact ale advertiserului sunt demeterandras@rmdsz.ro și +40745600964.
</message-for-police>
</conclusion>
</output>
```
